instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board here with no display. It has the usual dirt and some surface corrosion for a board this age, but nothing too serious.
 It will chime and I get usb activity, the screen gets energized(goes to deep black when booting) but never show a picture. Tried with a spare screen so it's definitely a board issue
I checked around the LVDS connector and L9008 was blown. Replaced with part from donor but still no image.
What should I check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Post voltage for pins 2/3, 4, 6, 7 of J9000.
If some voltage misses, compare diode mode reading with working board.

Be sure L9004/80 are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Sorry for the delay [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] , put this one at the bottom of my queue for a bit. Here are the readings with screen connected:
pin 2    3.244v
pin 4    3.289v
pin 6    3.288v
pin 7    3.288v
All voltages seem to be present, and I checked the inductors have same voltage on both sides. Also <RESISTOR>R9008</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R9009</RESISTOR> measure 10k almost exactly, so I'm not sure what to check next

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Check if L9080 has practically short IN-OUT.
You can get same voltage, but high resistance can block bus communication.
Check <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM levels.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
L9080 has 1.3ohm through on both pins 1-2 and 3-4. Same as donor board I have, so I expect it's good. 
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> both read 3.15V, measured near <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>. <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> measures 12.6V so it's not boosting, but I can't see any image shining a torch through the screen, even when booted into OS and working mirrored via displayport adapter

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Did you change <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>?
Check all return resistors and diode mode to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> now, still no image or backlight
Checked continuity from <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL>-6 pins on LCD connector to <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> pads, all show continuity through resistors, pretty much 0ohm (or as close as my meter gets). Backlight voltage still 12.5V
Can <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> cause no image? never seen that before

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Image should appear BEFORE backlight.
However, as backlight signals are correct, you should get backlight now.

Did you check diode mode to ground on all return resistors?
Also check on video data lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Just came back to say all readings were close to known-working board.
I tried reballing SMC and now when the laptop powers on it no longer boots and I get one beep every 6 or so seconds. How did this happen? I've done quite a few SMC reballs before and never seen this happen as a result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Bad solders, damaged SMC in process, or moved components...
